# About me {#welcome}

My name is Fabian Z√∂felt (\[ÀàfabiÀêan Ààts≈ìf…õlt\]). I'm a linguist and PhD student at <a href="https://www.uni-bielefeld.de" target="_blank">Bielefeld University</a>. Currently, I'm working in the project <a href="https://www.uni-bielefeld.de/sfb/sfb1646/projekte/a01/" target="_blank"> Creativity in (morpho)syntactic variation. The role of analogy</a> at <a href="https://www.uni-bielefeld.de/sfb/sfb1646/index.xml" target="_blank"> CRC 1646: Linguistic Creativity in Communication</a>.

I'm especially interested in (morpho)syntactic phenomena such as non-canonical passive constructions and long-distance dependencies. My work is mainly focused on German and tries to combine descriptive approaches, empirical evidence, and minimal-generative perspectives. In my dissertation and as part of my work in project A01, I explore whether exceptional extraction from islands can be explained by analogy. My PIs and supervisors are [Jutta M. Hartmann](https://www.uni-bielefeld.de/fakultaeten/linguistik-literaturwissenschaft/personen/jutta-hartmann/) and [Andr√°s B√°r√°ny](https://andras.barany.at).

I'm also interested in historical linguistics and language change ‚Äì in particular, in questions such as what motivates grammaticalization processes and how these can be modeled syntactically.
